website_summaries.verdict: Melts evenly into skis or boards and ready for speed when it dries.
pros: Turns the action up a notch on Black Diamond runs and even  slushy conditions
Little to no smoke during the actual waxing process
cons: Can be a tad sticky on powder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wax! Have been using for a few years, only wax I ever purchase..
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this wax for a few years now, but finally have gotten around to writing a review. It. Is. FAST! I use it on a 2016(?) Burton Blunt, 156cm. Cannot remember the year of the board, but it is when it was produced with a sintered base. The wax absorbs really well and lasts for a few serious sessions. Usually riding in pretty cold/sometimes wet conditions (northeast) and I am always zooming by my friends (no pun intended). Cannot say anything bad about this wax. It also smells amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R.

customer_reviews.title: Zum makes great ski wax
customer_reviews.text: I have tried almost all of the Zum wax variations, this one last longer than expected for a race wax, very fast and easy to apply with the hot iron.
customer_reviews.author: kfb

customer_reviews.title: Great ski wax choice!
customer_reviews.text: Used this wax for the first time on my skis for a week's trip in Colorado a few weeks ago. My skis ran very smooth and fast on both powder and groomed hard pack and held up well for five straight days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Juno Fairbanks

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Wax
customer_reviews.text: Really good wax, can wax about three boards with it. Easy to use for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: dylon

customer_reviews.title: ... fairly warm (near 40 degF) weekend and it worked great. Also did a day recently at sub 20 ...
customer_reviews.text: Put this on for a fairly warm (near 40 degF) weekend and it worked great. Also did a day recently at sub 20 and was still faster than a friend on a factory tune/wax (new board). I don't feel like I'm losing much to temperature specific wax with this.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Wax for the snow
customer_reviews.text: My son received as a gift for Christmas and he Tried it out yesterday. Whether was a little on the warm side for winter though. Will rereview after colder weather use.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of 3 Boys-Val Y

customer_reviews.title: Like it says. Zoom.
customer_reviews.text: Melts very well with no smoking with low temp iron. Very fast at 32 and 20 degrees F, the only times I've sed it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was a fast wax noticed a real difference on flat ...
customer_reviews.text: Was a fast wax noticed a real difference on flat areas where speed was harder to maintain. It was moderate cold most times I used it. As a side note white waxes may leave a nicer "shine" on your board depending on what color your board is so don't be confused how the board may look especially if it is a dark colored board.
customer_reviews.author: Mario J. Altiery

customer_reviews.title: Fast wax for racing
customer_reviews.text: Great wax for racing. Quick to come up to speed. Good for dry SW snow and also for heavy days.
customer_reviews.author: Federico Giannelli

customer_reviews.title: OK wax for warm weather, no good in very cold weather.
customer_reviews.text: This wax is definately not for the cold cold weather. I will not buy again because I had issues at Killington. I would only recommend to use this wax if you go boarding in temperatures above 10 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Mercyme

customer_reviews.title: The wax went on well with an old iron I ...
customer_reviews.text: The wax went on well with an old iron I had.This was my first time waxing a board and I had no issues
customer_reviews.author: annette marie rossi

customer_reviews.title: ... I used it but it arrived quick and was easy to apply and spread over my base
customer_reviews.text: I didn't feel a difference in my riding when I used it but it arrived quick and was easy to apply and spread over my base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast in warm conditions for 3-4 days
customer_reviews.text: Ironed it on my skis myself and the wax lasted about 3-4 days of skiing in warm, slushy conditions in Utah. Pretty fast...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid wax. I would wax my board at the begging of the season with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I loved the board feel
customer_reviews.text: wax held up well to Colorado rough riding for 4-5 days, will likely need a recoat now, I loved the board feel.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Great Ski Wax
customer_reviews.text: I usually use SWIX wax on my skis. The first time I used ZUM I could feel a difference right away. Really fast and durable. One wax for all conditions is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W.

customer_reviews.title: Good wax
customer_reviews.text: Great wax for a warm day, best to hot iron though
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The wax worked well. I didn't notice any additional performance I get from cheaper wax ie (super hotsauce).
customer_reviews.author: John F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: ZUM wax is awesome. Skis are like lightning bolts with this stuff on.
customer_reviews.author: John Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The wax worked great and wasn't too difficult to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a soft wax and needs to be reapplied frequently. There are probably better-performing universal waxes out there.
customer_reviews.author: Tom R. Adler

customer_reviews.title: Nice Wax
customer_reviews.text: Used this for some All Mountain skiing and was up to the task. This wax was very easy to apply to the skis.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This wax meets all my expectations and the formulation is great so that it performs well in many different temperatures and contitions.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Tilstra

customer_reviews.title: Yay!
customer_reviews.text: I gotta admit, I never waxed my board with this stuff, as I have my own wax. But my cabin members never complained, and it seemed to work well for them. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: overall good wax
customer_reviews.text: this is a good wax, little tougher to put on and take off at first. but once you wax it like you are supposed to then you'll be flying and be doing anything you want. great wax for a weather that varies.
customer_reviews.author: albert walters

customer_reviews.title: No complaint on the wax itself
customer_reviews.text: I have no comment on the wax itself. I tried to wax my board at home without the specified tools and reaped the consequences of it within the first 100ft of snowboarding during spring break.
customer_reviews.author: Deakon Mincey

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Who knew? You need several other products to make this wax work. Also, after watching the instruction video, you will realize that this once simple wax takes a very long and hard time to apply properly. I spent the time expecting good results but alas, NO DIFFERENCE!
customer_reviews.author: jasper

customer_reviews.title: great fast wax
customer_reviews.text: great fast wax, not too expensive. did 4 boards with 1/2 bar so definitely, get a kit and wax your own boards and save $
customer_reviews.author: jschinto

customer_reviews.title: This is a fast hard wax that is more difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast hard wax that is more difficult to apply and scrape than other cheaper stuff. I skied it for two solid days at Mammoth and it's still on there. I'm no expert, but it outlasts other waxes so you don't have to apply as often. It's worth the trouble and expense.
customer_reviews.author: captain kaos

customer_reviews.title: Great US made iron on wax
customer_reviews.text: Got some last year at a ski store. Couldn't find it after Spring came. Works very nicely and lasts well. Glad it's on Prime. Also like their Chill version and the Fluoro's
customer_reviews.author: Warren Pushaw

product_meta.title: ZUMWax Ski/Snowboard Racing Wax - Universal - 100 Gram - Incredibly Fast in All Temperatures !!!
product_meta.description: This is a 100% Hydrocarbon Racing Wax. This wax has no fluorocarbon material in the blend. It is 100% high performance paraffinic hydrocarbons. Although it can be looked upon as an economical racing wax, the colder waxes perform very well alone and the warmer waxes make an acceptable base layer for ZUMWax High Fluoro. Please refer to ZUMWax.com for How to Apply Iron On Wax instructional videos. ZUMWAX is SUPER FAST!
feature_bullets: This is a Universal Hydrocarbon RACING Wax for all types of skis and snowboards. INCREDIBLY FAST in ALL Temperatures, try it & you will be amazed how much faster you are going to be!
100 gram / 3.5 oz Single Bar -- Made in USA
Air Temperature Range: 10°C to -30°C or 50°F to -22°F
Snow Temperature Range: 0°C to -30°C or 32°F to -22°F
